node.title: Stacey Abrams Says Money and Peer Pressure Can Hold Politicians Accountable
node.description: Abrams' comments came from upcoming interview from three-time NBA champion Stephen Curry's new podcast Fifteen Minutes from Home.

node.title: House Hunting in Greece: Seaside Splendor on Tinos Isle for $1.8 Million
node.description: Greeks increasingly see real estate as a safer investment than currencies or commodities, and ‘people are buying like there’s no tomorrow.’

node.title: What Is the Staples Center in Los Angeles Changing Its Name To?
node.description: The historic Los Angeles venue will get an official new name this Christmas, following one of the biggest naming deals in sports history.

node.title: Better CEO Vishal Garg 'Sorry' After Mass Firing Over Zoom: 'I Blundered the Execution'
node.description: "I own the decision to do the layoffs, but in communicating it, I blundered the execution. In doing so, I embarrassed you," Vishal Garg wrote in a letter.

node.title: Blaze forces closure of campgrounds, wineries and tourist attractions in Margaret River region
node.description: Campgrounds, wineries and caves are evacuated as a bushfire threatens lives and homes around the Boranup Forest near Margaret River in WA's South West.

node.title: France releases man held as possible suspect in Khashoggi murder
node.description: Khalid Alotaibi, 33, is wanted by Turkey to face justice over the brutal killing, but the man detained in Paris wasn't him.

node.title: California’s Reparations Task Force Meets Again
node.description: The first-in-the-nation effort is tackling fraught questions about who deserves payment and how much.

node.title: Alberto Lucio Named As Marine, 20, Killed Helping Crash Victims on Interstate
node.description: A driver and passenger in a disabled SUV were taken to hospital in critical condition.

node.title: Japanese Billionaire Arrives at Space Station for Tourist Trip
node.description: Yusaku Maezawa, the founder of the clothing retailer Zozo, will spend 12 days in orbit with a production assistant who will document his stay.

node.title: Pastor Leaves His Church After Appearing on HBO Drag Show
node.description: A United Methodist Church pastor in Indiana stepped down after performing in drag and speaking about inclusion on the show “We’re Here.”

node.title: India's top military commander killed in helicopter crash
node.description: Chief of Defense Staff General Bipin Rawat, who was the first person ever to hold the title, was killed along with his wife and 12 other people.

node.title: Omicron can evade vaccines, but Pfizer says booster jabs do the trick
node.description: While it appears that Omicron has a "very large" advantage over previous strains, it doesn't appear to be making people sicker, and Pfizer says a booster shot "neutralized" it in the lab.

node.title: Metaverse now: The top AR and VR devices you can buy today
node.description: The metaverse isn't just a concept — with the right gear, you can start exploring it immediately.  Here's how.

node.title: Body of missing woman found day after boyfriend charged with murder
node.description: Detectives used tattoos to identify Kathleen Moore, who was last seen out with friends in late November.

node.title: Hate crimes up 100% in NYC, driven by anti-Asian crimes
node.description: Overall, there were 503 hate crimes this year as of December 5, up from 252 in 2020 — a 100% increase, the NYPD said.

node.title: Britain Will Not Send Top Officials to the Beijing Olympics
node.description: “There will be effectively a diplomatic boycott,” Prime Minister Boris Johnson said of the decision to join the United States and others in registering discontent over human-rights abuses in China.

node.title: Woman, 70, Attacked by 'Huge' Raccoon Gets Animal in Headlock: 'Thought I Was Going to Die'
node.description: Donna Sanginario from Massachusetts was left needing rabies shots after the raccoon attacked while she was putting up Christmas decorations.

node.title: Reddit Recap 2021: The Most Popular Threads of The Year Revealed
node.description: With its annual recap feature, Reddit has revealed its most popular posts, communities and themes of 2021. Both gaming and cryptocurrencies lead the pack.

node.title: Experts say economy needs some pandemic retirees to "unretire"
node.description: Americans are already working more days, longer hours and later in life than people in other industrial countries, but the average age of retirement ticked down during the pandemic.

node.title: The head of Instagram will take the hot seat in a congressional hearing.
node.description: Lawmakers are expected to grill Mr. Mosseri over leaked internal research that said the app had a toxic effect on some teenagers.

node.title: Congress gets a crash course on cryptocurrency.
node.description: The chief executives of six cryptocurrency companies will face questions from the House Financial Services Committee about risk and regulation.

node.title: China Media Pundit Says He Hopes Joe Biden Lives to See LA Olympics Boycott
node.description: Beijing says it isn't bothered by the U.S. diplomatic boycott of the Winter Games, but diplomats and state media personalities are lining up to criticize it on social media.

node.title: Climber allowed to keep $169,000 of gems he found on Mont Blanc
node.description: The precious stones had remained hidden in a metal box that was on board an Indian plane that crashed some 50 years earlier.

node.title: More than 50 cities competing for remote workers
node.description: Cities like Tulsa, Oklahoma, are competing for workers who are up for grabs now that they can work from anywhere.

node.title: Group Backed by Top Companies Moves to Combat A.I. Bias in Hiring
node.description: The organization has created a format for evaluating the technology, which is often used to screen job candidates.

node.title: Hydrocephalus Symptoms Explained As Nick Cannon's 5-Month-Old Son Zen Dies of Brain Cancer
node.description: The TV presenter announced the death of his youngest son on his talk show, and said he first noticed something was wrong because of his "interesting breathing."

node.title: Omicron has "robust ability" to evade vaccines, but there is good news
node.description: Experts in South Africa have raced to test vaccines against the new variant.

node.title: Who Is Bipin Rawat? Helicopter Crashes With India's Top General Aboard
node.description: Defense chief General Bipin Rawat was aboard an Mi-17V5 helicopter that crashed near the town of Coonoor in southern India.

node.title: Wendy's Drive-Thru Customer Fires Gun Over Order 'Taking Too Long': Police
node.description: Police told journalists that Tia Taylor reportedly fired the shots because she "was upset with her order."

node.title: Hawaii Weather for December: What Is the Forecast for the Rest of the Month?
node.description: The threat of heavy rain and thunderstorms remains in some parts of Hawaii through Wednesday morning, the National Weather Service said.
